casebody.data:
715 A.2d 994 IN THE MATTER OF N.J.S.A 2C:52-6 PETITION FOR EXPUNGEMENT OF THE RECORDS OF T.P.D., APPELLANT. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Argued July 14, 1998 Decided July 28 1998.

Before Judges WALLACE and EICHEN.

Raymond F. Slattery, argued the cause for appellant (Catania & Harrington, attorneys; Mr. Slattery, on the brief). Steven E. Braun, Senior Assistant Prosecutor, argued the cause for respondent State of New Jersey (Ronald S. Favo, Passaic County Prosecutor, attorney; Mr. Braun, of counsel and on the brief). Stephen H. Monson, Deputy Attorney General, argued the cause for Attorney General of the State of New Jersey, Amicus Curiae (Peter Vemiero, Attorney General, attorney; Mr. Monson, of counsel and on the brief). PER CURIAM.

The judgment of the Law Division is affirmed substantially for the reasons expressed by Judge Rothenberg in his opinion reported at 314 N.J.Super. 643, 715 A.2d 1048 (Law Div.1997).
